qas.question: When was John Cabot's voyage commissioned?
Where was Cabot trying to find a route to via the North Atlantic?
Which explorer did Cabot make a mistake similar to?

context: The foundations of the British Empire were laid when England and Scotland were separate kingdoms. In <a0_0>1496<a0_0/> <a1_0>King Henry VII of England<a1_0/>, following the successes of Spain and Portugal in overseas exploration, commissioned John Cabot to lead a voyage to discover a route to <a2_0>Asia<a2_0/> via the North Atlantic. Cabot sailed in 1497, five years after the European discovery of America, and although he successfully made landfall on the coast of <a3_0>Newfoundland<a3_0/> (mistakenly believing, like <a4_0>Christopher Columbus<a4_0/>, that he had reached Asia), there was no attempt to found a colony. Cabot led another voyage to the Americas the following year but nothing was heard of his ships again.
